did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: William Stanley Braithwaite Collection, 1899-1928, n.d.
did.physdesc: This collection is comprised of 4700 items.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Stanley Braithwaite Collection, Accession # 8990, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased from Miss Margaret Carpenter of Norfolk, Virginia on September 13, 1968.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: William Stanley Braithwaite was an African-American poet, critic and anthologist; professor of creative literature at Atlanta University; and a recipient of the Spingarn medal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the correspondence of William Stanley Briathwaite, noted black poet, critic, and anthologist, consisting mainly of letters written to Braithwaite in connection with his anthologies.
